content.prompt: A local department store estimates that 10 percent of its customers return the merchandise they purchase. Let the random variable R represent the number of returns for a random sample of 40 customers. Assume that random variable R follows a binomial distribution. What is described by the value of (408)(0.1)8(0.9)32 ?

choices.label: The mean of the random variable
The variance of the random variable
The standard deviation of the random variable
The probability that 8 customers in the sample will return merchandise
The probability of selecting a sample of 40 customers who will all return merchandise

unit.text: 4: Probability, Random Variables, and Probability Distributions

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Interpret statistical calculations and findings to assign meaning or assess a claim.
